Title: Object: Papyrus Chester Beatty 5
Description: Papyrus Chester Beatty V; sheet 1(fourteen fragments); Hieratic literary text recto and verso. Late Egyptian Miscellanies. Recto 1-2, Verso 7. Recto: Hymn to the Nile; Various Short Texts in Letter Form Verso: Conclusion of Short Texts; Jottings; Magical Texts
Curator's comments: Published: Gardiner, Hieratic Papyri Vol. 1, pp. 45-52, Vol. 2. Plate 23, Recto 1-2; Verso 7. Neveu, RdE 41, p. 147 [Recto. 7, 8]. For edition of the Hymn to the Inundation: W. Helck, Der Text des "Nilhymnus", KÄT, Wiesbaden 1972; D. van der Plas, L'Hymne à la crue du Nil, EU 4, Leiden 1986, passim und Bd. II, 158-161. The text of this poem is available on T.L.A (http://aaew.bbaw.de/tla/) Translation: M. Lichtheim, Ancient Egyptian Literature. Volume I: The Old and Middle Kingdoms, Berkeley, Los Angeles, London, 1973 (=1975), 204-210.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381088) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381088)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragmentary, loss, fractured, bloom Black ink Red ink Tabbed: silk Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alfred Chester Beatty
Donated by: Lady Edith Chester Beatty
